alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Eastern Hampshire; Western Franklin; Western Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 7:29PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms approaching western Hampshire and western Franklin Counties... At 725 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers and a few strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Grafton, New York to near Valatie, New York. These showers and storms have a history of producing strong wind gusts and some wind damage. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Locations impacted include... Northampton, Greenfield, Deerfield, Monroe, Williamsburg, Bernardston, Buckland, Conway, Shelburne, Ashfield, Colrain, Westhampton, Whately, Charlemont, Chesterfield, Worthington, Goshen, Cummington, Leyden and Heath. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. These storms may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Franklin; Eastern Hampshire; Western Franklin; Western Hampshire
